entries.title: US Congress to posthumously honour slain teenager Emmett Till
entries.description: The unanimous vote awarded Till and his mother, both civil rights icons, the Congressional Gold Medal.

entries.title: Nepal to release serial killer Charles ‘The Serpent’ Sobhraj
entries.description: The French national, also known as 'The Bikini Killer', has been accused of murdering more than 20 backpackers in Asia.

entries.title: US confidence rebounds, ending year on high note
entries.description: Despite high inflation, rising interest rates and a possible recession, US consumer confidence saw a sharp rebound.

entries.title: US sanctions Iranian officials over protest-related executions
entries.description: The US Treasury has announced new sanctions targeting officials including Iran's prosecutor general.

entries.title: Photos: Female students turned away from Afghan universities
entries.description: The UN's mission in Afghanistan asked the Taliban-run administration to 'immediately' revoke the decision.

entries.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried consents to be extradited to US
entries.description: Cryptocurrency entrepreneur faces fraud charges and could be flown from Bahamas to US as early as Wednesday.

entries.title: How important is the relationship between Australia and China?
entries.description: Trade partners mark 50 years of diplomatic ties with renewed efforts to improve relations.

entries.title: WHO chief ‘very concerned’ over COVID situation in China
entries.description: WHO head Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus appeals for detailed information as China battles a surge of COVID cases.

entries.title: US winter storm expected to collide with peak holiday travel
entries.description: People in the US are preparing for some of the coldest weather in recent memory as the Christmas holiday approaches.

entries.title: US confirms Patriot system for Ukraine, Zelenskyy arrives in DC
entries.description: Washington renews its pledge to continue military aid to Kyiv for 'as long as it takes' to repel Russian invasion.

entries.title: US housing market slump deepens for 10th month in November
entries.description: Excluding sharp drop at pandemic start, home sales are now at their slowest annual pace since November 2010.

entries.title: Former US President Trump paid no income tax in 2020: Report
entries.description: Records released by a US congressional committee reveal Trump used business losses to offset his tax liability.

entries.title: Photos: UK ambulance staff follow nurses in strike over pay
entries.description: The government is calculating public opinion will turn on the unions, but opinion polls show high levels of support.

entries.title: Peru’s new president reshuffles cabinet as Mexico ties tested
entries.description: Dina Boluarte changes some of her ministers as tensions rise with Mexico over its support for her predecessor.

entries.title: ‘My heart is bleeding’: Afghan women devastated by university ban
entries.description: The Taliban's decision to suspend women from accessing higher education has extinguished a rare source of hope for many.

entries.title: US Capitol riot: What to expect from January 6 panel’s report
entries.description: The January 6 congressional panel's final report is expected to focus on Donald Trump's role in the Capitol attack.

entries.title: Photos: Sidecar ambulances help pregnant women in India
entries.description: Motorbike ambulances are a vital service for women in remote areas who otherwise wouldn't receive medical care.

entries.title: Four soldiers arrested after alleged coup attempt in The Gambia
entries.description: Barrow's 2016 win against ex-leader Yahaya Jammeh was widely viewed as a boost for democracy where coups are common.

entries.title: Putin says gov’t providing Russian army ‘everything it asks for’
entries.description: Russian leader says there is no cap on financial assistance to the army, which has suffered several defeats in Ukraine.

entries.title: In Uganda, injectable HIV treatment offers hope to patients
entries.description: The treatment is the first non-pill option against HIV and studies show that it outperforms the efficacy of oral pills.

entries.title: UK post-Brexit settlement scheme for EU citizens unlawful: Court
entries.description: The High Court says Britain is breaching the deal by requiring EU citizens to reapply for the right to live and work.

entries.title: Timeline: Taliban crackdown on Afghan women’s education, rights
entries.description: Group has backtracked on promises to guarantee certain rights for girls and women since its return to power last year.

entries.title: UK ambulance workers join widening strike for above-inflation pay
entries.description: Unions representing nurses and ambulance workers threaten more walkouts if the government keeps refusing to discuss pay.

entries.title: ‘By the skin of our teeth’: A UK foster carer’s monthly costs
entries.description: How a freelance copywriter overseeing a household of eight navigates a tight monthly budget.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia wants dialogue after Jordan meeting: Iran minister
entries.description: Several factors have delayed a sixth round of direct bilateral talks, which could be held at level of foreign ministers.

entries.title: Can an apology heal the harm left by slavery?
entries.description: With the aim of addressing colonial-era abuses, Dutch government apologises for its role in the slave trade.

entries.title: Lionel Messi’s win is a triumph of genius and tolerance
entries.description: With the ball and the bisht, the Argentine superstar faced questions — but the champion prevailed each time.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy travels to US, to meet President Biden
entries.description: Ukrainian leader expected to address US Congress in his first known trip outside Ukraine since Russia war started.

entries.title: Anti-racist faces trial for defaming neo-Nazi in Portugal
entries.description: Neo-Nazi activist Mario Machado accuses anti-racism campaigner Mamadou Ba of 'injuring his honour' on social media.

entries.title: Over 100 Rohingya stranded off India’s coast, many feared dead
entries.description: As many as 16-20 refugees may have died of thirst and hunger or have drowned, according to relatives and activists.

entries.title: Burkina Faso denies paying Russia’s Wagner group with mine rights
entries.description: Ghana's president alleged that Burkina Faso had hired Russia's Wagner mercenaries to help fight armed groups.

entries.title: Netanyahu, the godfather of modern Israeli fascism
entries.description: Israel's next Netanyahu-led coalition government may be the most extremist in its history.

entries.title: Germany returns 20 Nigerian bronzes, noting its ‘dark past’
entries.description: More than 5,000 ancient artefacts are estimated to have been looted from Nigeria by coloniser England.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 301
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 301st day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Cheers for Fiji’s ‘new PM’ but parliament swearing-in delayed
entries.description: Fiji's police force has called for calm and urged 'all Fijians to respect the political process' amid power transition.

entries.title: Timeline: Half a century of oil spills in Nigeria’s Ogoniland
entries.description: Since oil was discovered in commercial quantities in Nigeria in 1958, thousands of oil spill incidents have happened.

entries.title: Peru declares Mexico envoy ‘persona non grata’, asks him to leave
entries.description: It is the latest escalation of tensions between two nations after Mexico announced asylum for Pedro Castillo's family.

entries.title: US House committee votes to make Trump tax returns public
entries.description: The Democrat-led panel voted in a closed session to release six years of records pertaining to the former president.

entries.title: Beijing expects COVID surge as mutation risks concern experts
entries.description: Hospitals should expand ICU beds as a priority, with COVID peak expected to last until end of January, expert says.

entries.title: US to send $1.8bn aid to Ukraine, including Patriot system: Media
entries.description: Media reports suggest Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy may travel to Washington, DC to meet US President Joe Biden.

entries.title: Musk says to step down as Twitter CEO after successor found
entries.description: Musk says he will step down from platform as soon as he finds someone "foolish enough to take the job".

entries.title: Twitter secretly boosted US military propaganda: Investigation
entries.description: Twitter helped promote US military’s activities in Middle East, according to an investigation based on company files.

entries.title: The racist killing of teen Cassius Turvey that shocked Australia
entries.description: Alleged murder of Cassius is the latest in a number of attacks on Australia's Indigenous children and young people.
